radiographic_examinations.findings: Bicuspid aortic valve with moderate regurgitation, mildly to moderately dilated and hypertrophied left ventricle, ejection fraction of 50%.
High-velocity retrograde flow in the left vertebral artery, which reduced on exertion.
Stenosis of the subclavian artery ruled out.
Worsening (moderate to severe) aortic insufficiency, asymmetrical diastolic flow jet, mild decrease of left ventricular ejection fraction, patent aortic bypass conduit.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Worsening aortic insufficiency correlates with progression of symptoms.

radiographic_examinations.findings: High flow in both the native aorta and bypass graft, substantial diastolic retrograde flow throughout the system.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Retrograde fractions in several arteries consistently reduced after atropine administration.
